pros: she is a good person and she is always smiling and always ready to correct a staff when ever they make a mistake.
cons: she is a workaholic and she needs to take a break
Very small business team, many areas to coordinate with.

job_title: Community Support Worker in Winnipeg, MB
pros: Organized depending on which program u work at
cons: Wage decrease if you switch from other programs to day program

pros: Regular social service agency in Winnipeg
cons: usual cons of working in non-profit

job_title: Assistant Resource Coordinator in Winnipeg, MB
pros: Good pay, good benefits, good values, pension, autonomy, good leadership. Overall nice place to work
cons: Not many cons. Hard to move up in the company. Can feel overwhelming. Sometimes overworked.

review_title: Very good in humanity terms, average in compensation
pros: Good management, relaxed atmosphere, encouraging of non-toxic environment
cons: If one does not have a graduate degree as I do, the pay is low, very low for some very responsible positions caring for vulnerable people.

pros: Flexibility, good environment , social value added to the community
cons: None the organization is good to work for

review_title: This organization needs change badly, could be alot better for staff
pros: Some health benefits, hiring process moves relatively quickly.
cons: Low pay, poorly managed, their values don't line up with their actions, executive staff is not very supportive, HR is difficult to communicate with.

review_title: Amazing organization committed to helping people!
pros: Interacting with the most amazing people everyday is the best. New Directions is truly committed to helping all sorts of people in a person-centred approach. There are lots of different programs, so there is room for movement and seeing other kinds of things. With New Directions there is lots of variety, no days are the same. Everyone is very approachable and receptive of your ideas.
cons: Depending on your job, and whether or not you are a bleeding heart (you might be guilty of this if you are applying to New Directions) your job may be emotionally tiring, but it was also be rewarding.

review_title: Get physically assaulted attacked for pennies!
pros: Sense of accomplishment, some clients were pleasant to befriend
cons: Hours all over the place. Have to pay for your own gas to pick up clients and back home. Will schedule you for one hour shifts where you actually lose money due to gas and maintenance costs. Refuses to give you full time so they can screw you out of benefits. About once every couple of months you can expect to be physically assaulted by your clients. After the last one I put in my two weeks, had enough of being paid $14/hr so that I can put my life at risk. Terrible pay for the type of work required.
